review: I've been here numerous times. Love the location and am always seated quickly no matter how busy. I have ALWAYS had great service. And often times they give my kiddo a balloon if they aren't out of helium (which they seem to be out of it a lot). It's expensive but expected. Down side: The food. OMG the food is terrible. I'm a vegetarian and they don't have many options. And the ones they have always taste horrible. Really, really bad food. Wish I could give more stars for everything else that is great. =(

"We were seated by a friendly hostess. Our waiter was Joel. My sister and I split an avocado chicken salad. Joel was more than pleasant when we asked for this extra service. After we got our food Joel came by often to check on us. The food at Red Robin is always great.  The great service by Joel made our evening complete.

Some days when you need a convenient or fun place to eat, it's nice to choose a sure bet.  Red Robin is it.  You know the service will be friendly and the food consistent.  On Tuesdays it's fun to take the kids to meet "Red" the restaurant character.

Went there with my wife on a date and it was packed! I was a bit worried at first but as soon as we walked up we were greeted with a smile and sat down. The Service was Amazing! Our appetizer was brought out within mins of being order and our food was delicious! The waiter never let our drinks get empty. It was by far the best Red Robin I have ever been too. Good Job Guys Keep It up

I came here with two friends. Our drink orders came as soon as our server could get them from the bar. One friend ordered an appetizer, and it came out quickly. My friend and I ordered burgers, and our other friend ordered a chicken sandwich. I ordered the guac-bacon burger, add mushrooms, with cheddar cheese, and sweet potato fries. Our food orders came out together. My plate had french fries on it. I immediately mentioned this to the server, and he said he'd get me some sweet potato fries. I bit into my burger, and realized there was no cheese on it. I asked the server for some cheddar cheese. He offered to have my burger remade, and I declined. I just wanted the cheese. After he brought me the cheese, he checked my ticket in the computer and said he had put everything in correct, and the manager was speaking to the kitchen about the issues. A few minutes later, the manager came out and told me the server had put the order in wrong. I work in the food industry, and I KNOW that whatever comes up on the receipt is going to be what was put in. The receipt had what I ordered on it, not what came to the table. So, I ask the following questions: 1) Where are my sweet potato fries? 2) Where is my cheddar cheese? 3) WHY IS THE MANAGER TRYING TO LIE TO ME AND TRYING TO COVER UP A MISTAKE THAT WAS MADE BY THE KITCHEN?!? Oh, and please clean the bottom of your tables. I accidentally hit my knee on the table and it came back black. GROSS.

Red robin now offers gluten free hamburger buns. That really opens up the menu for those who need to eat gluten free. They even cook the fries in a separate fryer. It was great to have a burger that didn't have to be wrapped in lettuce.

Unfortunately over the years the quality of the food at red robins has gone downhill. I used to eat here at least once a week but over the years the quality of the food is gotten worse. The last two times I've even here I felt sick. Great people great management great location but the food is not the best. Red Robin go back to the way you used to make your burgers. This review should be at least a four star but it's not only because of the food.

If you come in expecting mediocre (at best) service, you won't be disappointed. I usually finish eating my meal before my refill of fries arrives at my table. It's also not uncommon to finish your meal dehydrated from the lack of drink refills.  On the plus side the burgers are good and the kids meals can get a free refill of macaroni and cheese or spaghetti. The bottomless steak fries are good with a large variety of dipping sauces.   The prices are reasonable, the menu has become extensive and they appear to have a well stocked bar. There are plenty if TVs to watch the game on as well.  If you're not in a hurry and you're willing to keep flagging down your server, then this is your place.
Lunch day after Christmas... Thought the wait was going to be 20 minutes but got in fast... Turn around for food to be right in front of me was quite fast... Can't go wrong with any burger here...

Great Red Robin! The service from our server Michael was excellent.  Everyone on the staff seemed friendly.  There was a huge line when we came in and the staff managed to work the crowd and get people moved through really quickly. I would have given 5 stars but my burger was a bit charbroiled and there is a huge difference between well done and almost burned. Overall I would recommend the Bend store highly.

Love me some Red Robin! Buzz clucks are my all time. And those pretzel bites apps are SO good I can't stop myself whenever I'm in town. Ultimate margarita is awesome too. Whenever I go in there, everything is served to me systematically and everything comes out quick and deliciously! Typical burger joint feel and food. It's a constant in my rotation of restaurants!

Why even have a road side/ to go pick up and tell us "15 minuets tops" and then make us wait on average 30 minuets? I've given the inside a try time and time again and them went to the "to go" self pickup because i figured I'd at least then have my food sooner. This is the 3rd time I've come in, been ignored, and have seen my food sitting waiting to be boxed but the servers are too busy playing on their phones and talking to their co workers to even care to ask if I could be helped. My food has come to me cold and I only live 10 minuets away from old mill. This is pathetic. Bend burger is less then a mile away and has better service and food.
They have a great happy hour appetizer  menu that lasts all day! And the smokey chipotle margarita is killer which is so worth putting my burger on a lettuce wrap instead of a bun.

I have been going to Red Robin since 1988. I had high hopes when I moved to Bend in August that this would be the same as the rest. It wasn't. The service is absolutely awful. We have been three times. Each worse than the previous. Drinks to forever to come to the table. If you order an appetizer two things will happen. You either get it with your meal or seriously now, after. Refills on drinks won't happen and the endless fries are so small you have to order multiple times and they seem to take their time getting them. The burgers used to be sent through machine and slightly grilled. Now they grill them and burn them every time regardless of some pink no pink or well done. My wife ordered a burger well done and got the opposite, they told her pink inside was normal for well done. This place is bad from the wait staff to management. Go to a brewery to get a burger. Don't waste your time.

Their happy hour is normally really good. I have never had bad service there.  It is your classic Red Robin Burger joint. Nothing different than any of the others. Able to sit large groups of necessary, dinner time can cause there to be a little wait but its nothing too drastic. Good Burgers. Good Wraps Good for first dates for kids under 21. Good for birthdays. They sing to them so be prepared to sweat in embarrassment.

My family and I visit Red Robin a couple of times per month and we always feel like valued customers. The service is consistently superior, the food is excellent and the atmosphere is great! You won't get bored by the menu as it changes frequently, yet the tried-and-true menu items remain. During my last visit, Brad was my server and he really went the extra mile even though he was very busy. My glass never got empty and he kept the french frie refills coming! Can't say enough good things about this restaurant.
Food is most often good - but service seldom is:( Like to sit outside is the weather cooperates. When it is busy the noise is too loud.

I was staying at a nearby hotel and stopped in around 9:10 for a late night snack.  Taking a seat at the bar, it took about 5 minutes for the bartender to acknowledge me.  Apparently he mistook me for another obnoxious customer who he was avoiding.  Apologizing, he quickly took my order, and offered me the happy hour upgrade on my beer.  Unfortunately, it took the kitchen over 20 minutes to generate a burger and fries...  I wish I could give them a great review, but overall it was just a pretty mediocre experience.

Used to go to the Red Robin's in San Diego for years and loved them. My fiancé and I have come to this one twice, and this 2nd visit will be our last.  Came a little after 3pm on a Saturday. Not too busy, we were seated promptly, the waitress asked what she could get us a little fast, but we knew we wanted a good local IPA (which they don't have good choices of). She got us our beer, asked us what we wanted to order -we weren't ready, she came up not even a minute later (and I felt she was in a hurry at this point). Then we're ready to order, I put the menus at the edge of the table to show we were ready, FINALLY after at least 10 minutes a different waiter came up and said the other girl was busy, and took our order (2 new gourmet burgers).  We waited.... and waited... and waited........ and waited. My fiancé ordered a 2nd beer. We waited.... and then we noticed the couple sitting at the table across from us that got seated about 15-20 minutes after we placed our order got their food!!! We FINALLY got our food and -- low and behold --it was COLD -all of it!, the fries, everything.  I was starving, but this was unacceptable ----especially to pay $13.95/each for?? And they didn't look good, it was obvious it had been sitting for a while.   So we just simply, without making a big stink, said it was cold, we're not eating it, just cash us out and we left. It happened the last time we were there. They apologized (not profusely or anything), didn't offer anything -no discount on the outrageously expensive beer, or anything -just said sorry. I had gotten a 22oz (yes, they are pretty big), and my fiancé got 2 16oz beers. The bill came to over $18 bucks. Uuggh...quite disappointing. We will never go here again. You can go to 10Barrel (which we do, often) --even though it's always jam-packed but get EXCELLENT service and MUCH better burgers, awesome beer for a few dollars less. Also, another suggestion would be Bend Burgers! Awesome burgers and service there too.

Five stars because of the view from the patio! Scenic river trails!! Nothing like this in California, I fell in-love with this certain Red Robin restaurant only because the view was amazing. Old Mill District itself is also beautiful and I like the fact that it's not only a shopping center-- it's also a great place for outdoor activities such as kayaking, paddle boarding and such. It outlooks the river where you can watch people SUP and kayak. Red Robin itself, I love their sauteed 'shroom burger and their bottomless unlimited fries!! :D The customer service was great, although it was quite busy. They need more employees!!
Meh about sums up my visit to Red Robin, thought I was in for a delicious burger, but it wasn't really anything special.

I go to Red's semi regularly, we ordered out as we wanted to relax after a hike. The knowledge of burgers and was all the more upon arrival. Three orders of fries were unsalted, my whiskey river BBQ burger had no BBQ sauce... I wish I would have listened to the yelp advice. I will not return and will not recommend this place to anyone. Your in Bend, go to a brew house...

My wife and I wanted an appetizer and a drink to tide us over to dinner. It was hot, we'd been walking a lot. We decided to take a taxi instead of walking back to our hotel. I had no service on my phone and it wouldn't connect to the wifi. I asked our server, Brad, if he knew the number for the local taxi company. Brad went behind the bar. The blonde barkeep with too much cleavage and not enough tact said, loud enough for everyone in the bar to hear, "How the f@&k should I know? Tell him to use his f@&king smartphone!" Brad returned a moment later with the number. Brad five stars all the way.  Blonde barkeep, one star .  I'm sorry we caused such duress asking a bartender for the number of a taxi. I think this was a unique experience for me as I've never been in a bar that didn't have a taxi company's business card taped next to the cash register. But maybe you haven't been a bartender long. Maybe you just got expelled from charm school.

We received a gift card and were forced to come here.  $75 goes a long way at Red Robin and thus had to come twice! The first experience was bland and sub par. Sugary drinks and super cheap starchy appetizers.  Despite our best efforts we only used half the gift card and were dreading coming back. Fortunately, tonight was an entirely different experience thanks to the attentive service of the bartender, Mell, and some better menu selections. The fish and chips are actually really good.  And we loved the wedge salads, crisp and satisfying, a steal for $3. We kept it simple and stuck with beer but we were impressed when Mell had our entrée split for us and coursed our meal without us asking. We assumed eating at Red Robin would mean throwing any dining etiquette out the window but we were happily proven wrong. We may venture back, even without a gift card.

Typical chain restaurant, but they have a great variety to choose from. I wish this wasn't a teenager destination after movies. Nothing Red Robin can do about that though. I just sit in the bar now where they can't go. :)
Red Robin has proven itself to provide tasty burgers and milkshakes and every time I've gone there, I've received great service.
Little crowded, little noisy, service was very good, despite all the craze,we came in as a large party and they were able to accommodate, good food, reasonable pricing, nice location.

I am updating to 3 stars because after my email to corporate, the manager of this franchise group contacted me to apologize and make it right (not the immediate restaurant manager, but above her). He explained why on a few things, like awaiting renovations for a decor overhaul; and he thanked me for giving him extensive constructive feedback. He sent me a few free burger tickets too, which can't hurt! So for this Red Robin, I'd say owners and high level management have good intentions, just bad delivery, hopefully it will get better! The manager I talked to also said he doesn't usually watch the yelp ratings on his restaurants, but will start :-)

Typical of any Red Robin.  Friendly staff, quality food for what you pay for.   Would have given more stars but the restroom was filthy.  I'm a male and not many restrooms will make me cringe but this one did.  I ate there around 3pm so the lunch crowd must have made the mess.  Might be a good idea to clean up the restrooms after lunch?  My table was sticky too even though it had been cleaned.
The fry appetizer sucked! It said smothered in 1000 island, there was barely any to be seen. The cheese that it was supposed to be smothered in, two KRAFT(R) singles melted under heat lamps.

Giving 2 stars because honestly our kids always love this place. Never are they disappointed. However, the last few times we have been in, the place (esp bathrooms) is filthy, staff are not overly friendly, food is mediocre at best & the water tastes hideous. Tonight the food was barely warm, fries were actually cold & stale, the waitress was wonderful but another person brought out the food & she had minimal interest in making sure all was well. We had no silverware & some things were not right with our order.

As we wait for a table, there are 3 empty tables that have been emptied from patrons for almost 10 minutes in the bar area, the waitress don't really care to help get tables cleared so patrons can sit, the nice woman who greets Annette went above and beyond her job to help us get a seat in the bar area. I currently give Red Robin a 1 star for poor service. I hope service gets better, my girlfriend and I come here for date night and a movies at least 3 times a month.

I don't know what other people are on about. Red Robin, and this one in particular, is a great restaurant. We enjoy our food, and we always get way more fries than what we ordered, as long as we request to get our fries before our food comes. Their shakes are great, their food is yummy, their staff is friendly, and we get to sit out by the river while we eat, if it's not too busy. They also accommodate large groups, and if there is a wait for a table, we window shop at the old mill.

I recently went to the local Red Robin and found out that the side salad which was once a $2.00 add on to a burger combo is now $5.00 , the old side salad was even bigger than the new one. This simply is a corporate move to gouge people that come in to Red Robin restaurants , give me a break , now the salad is smaller and more expensive, way to go  Red Robin corporate , you will just loose more sales due to this move , I am letting everyone I know that goes to Red Robin not to add on the smaller and more expensive side salad .  I am a regular customer to Red Robin , too bad because the people that work there are always friendly .

Its ok. The service isn't as good as it once once and the food has slipped a little as well. Is it a fun place to take the kids? Yes most of the time but its pretty blah. You could do better at most of the local hamburger joints instead.

We visit this restaurant once a year during our annual family trek to Sunriver.  I often visit other Red Robin's establishments (i.e., Roseville, CA) and so am very familiar with the Red Robin style of service and it's brand.  On this visit, we had several issues which resulted in an overall poor experience.  In talking with the manager, he stated that this restaurant is under a different type of ownership compared to other Red Robin establishments (some type of independent ownership)....so I wonder if this is contributing to the service issues that we experienced.   The food is likely to be the same from Red Robin to Red Robin, so what will make this restaurant a success (or lack of) is its service.  First challenge....the restaurant does not carry all of the items on the menu which dissappointed my guests (no salmon, no gardenburger).  Second challenge....the food took over 30 minutes to be delivered to our table.   Third challenge...everyone's food was lukewarm (e.g., fries, burgers, mac n cheese).   Fourth challenge....bathrooms were filthy (it was the end of the day but I'm not sure why I should have to experience less then clean).   Fifth issue...waitress spilled salad dressing over new shoes (I understand that mistakes happen, but this usually results in a automatic visit from the manager - but he was a no show).   Sixth issue...the waiter staff seemed more fixated on closing down the restaurant than taking care of us.  Seventh issue (the biggest problem of all in my opinion)....I asked to speak to the waiter twice and he never came (note - we waited over 20 minutes for him to show-up).  Eventually I had to go find the manager myself as the family was ready to go.  In explaining the challenges, the manager took 20% off the bill, and gave me to coupons for $14 toward a future visit (note - only good in Bend though).   Based on our experience tonight, the entire meal should have probably been 50% or more off.  What we did enjoy was sitting outside along the river....very peaceful and entertaining.

This ain't your mamas Red Robin anymore. Previous famous flagship burgers have been reduced to a value meal burger at a crappy drive through. Buns are cheap with painfully obvious frozen patties that are thinner and lower in quality compared to fresh hand crafted beef patties of the past. Serving portions of fries reduced to a minimum that make it disuading to keep  asking for more. Caesar salad is now a small head of romaine lettuce placed intact in a bowl with a little bit of dressing drizzled on top. Seriously, you can't even cut up the lettuce? Oh, and finally for dessert, a Oreo "milk shake". A SMALL amount of crappy vanilla ice cream cut with probably skim milk mixed with the equivalent of one oreo for $3.99. There is more value in an old school ice cream sandwich and I get to scrape the chocolate wafer residual off my index finger and thumb with my teeth when I'm done with the main treat.  I feel sorry for those working in this puppy mill of a restaurant chain. Their livelihood and tips are contingent on an obvious corporate sellout for profit company that has turned a signature trademark into a smoldering bag of dog crap on your front porch. Congrats unknown named new CEO, you flew this one right into the side of the mountain at 600 mph.

I'm a vegetarian, but Hubby likes his burgers. Even though we don't have kids, we tend to go to Red Robin a lot. I get the $5 dinner salad, which is simple, tasty and fills me up. But now they've updated their menu. Raised the price of my salad, yet it is now two third (2/3!) smaller. Yep, I'd have to buy 3 ($15) to get what I used to get. Oh, they have now put it on a fancy plate. NOT worth going here anymore.

This place gets worse every time we go ..outside patio floor was filthy..not power washed in a long time..then they advertise "unlimited" fries..order a refill and finally after 10 minutes server comes back and says they are OUT of fries..!!!..Really @ 6:45 pm on Tuesday..Dont waste your time or $$$..

Uncooked appetizers, disgusting dirty menus and the outdoor seating and patio was nasty.   Hadn't been cleaned in quite awhile. Condiments we so sticky and obviously untouched by a bleach rag in months.  Yellow jackets were there for the filth.

Unfortunately this Red Robin falls short compared to others. Great location and the patio on the river could be great but it is very dirty and underkept. The staff does seem to care and try hard but the food is not comparable to other Red Robin locations. Alot of potential but poor execution.

This place seems to be going down hill . Every time we come here the quality of food is getting worse. The guy that brought our food didn't even know what kind of burgers they were. He also took our extra fries to a different table. When we did get the fries they were the ones from the bottom of the bag. The burgers are nothing special anymore. It's just more expensive than McDonald's.  We have made our last visit to this Red Robin.
Not great service. Messed up the order like 4 times, and couldn't get me my bottomless fries for like an 20 minutes, and I like fries. :)
This was an incredibly busy place and had only mediocre service. They could have used more help. We got some of our order correct but our waitress had tons of other tables and couldn't check back.

Food was good but service was the worst. Tossed between 4 servers, Chad had come by asked if we needed anything we asked for a togo box and the check, after 5 minutes of no ticket we had to pull over a server from anothet table so we could pay and leave.
Ok service. Asked if I wanted more fries....yes! Never received. It's a chain restaurant... Don't expect more than that.

This is very difficult to review because the food is great, the location is great, the atmosphere is standard "Red Robin" which is fine, but the service is very bad. We go here once a month for the fish and chips which are, to me, the best in the area. But we wait a long time to be served, a long time to have our order taken, they don't come back to see if you want something else, and then you wait a long time for your check. We've been to many Red Robin's all over the western USA, and the location of this one in Bend Oregon is one of the nicest places in the entire west. It's just beautiful here. But after about 15 visits to this location we're getting reluctant to go back because the service is consistently so incredibly slow. The waitresses are very courteous and friendly, I'm not sure why it's so slow. Also they have like the endless fries, well, if they never come back to ask if you want more that's kinda pointless. One time my wife flagged down the young lady, and 20 minutes later she'd still never brought anymore. Another 20 minutes from when you've obviously ended your meal to getting your check has to be a record of any place I've ever been. Lastly, we always go at off times, we never go during the rush hour, like instead of 12 noon we go at 11:15 AM, or instead of dinner time we go at 4:30 PM, but it's still slow. We've tried going at 12 noon straight up to see if the service was better and it wasn't.
Happy hour drinks don't seem to have booze.  Like drinking large glass of too sweet cranberry juice.  Got bigger buzz from breathing fresh Bend air off the Deschutes.

Always a favorite place to eat. Burnin' Love  burger with onion rings and a stout! Perfect meal to end a busy day.  Super busy, but if you sit in the bar area you can usually get a table and be served quickly. A little messy tonight, but it is a busy Friday night with a festival going on. Friendly staff, quick to get drinks.
Love this Red Robin! Best service and great food! I like there new menu options. I also really like that it is such a great family friendly option when we have the kids.
The service with a smile was what I've come to expect here.   It was loud but fun upon entering.    The food was good and my Mai tai cocktail was yummy!    Overall good experience!

Always very quick! Especially when you can ahead. They will give you limitless fries, drinks and sauces when you need. When it's too busy, the service is a bit lacking, but the food is always made at the same par, so you never have to ask who's the cook of the day.
Had a decent burger tonight. Love the bottomless fries. Probably should have gone with the bbq chicken wrap as the old standby. Look forward to coming back soon.

Extremely disappointed. I've been to plenty Red Robins before and this was my first visit to the one in Bend, Oregon at the Old Mill District. We went there with friends and was hoping for the normal great food. DIDN'T happen. They were out of the black angus burger patties and the burger they served to replace it wasn't even as good as McDonalds would have been. My friend ordered a prime rib dip sand which and the roll it was served on was hard and dry. My wife had a salad and it was pretty simple. Basically lettuce and cheese.  The service was also pretty slow.  I won't be back.

In the past, this Red Robin seemed to be providing exactly the kind of good food and service you'd expect from the chain, but lately I've noticed a turn for the worst.  The first bad experience I put down to it being a very crowded and understaffed day, but now that I've had two visits like this, I will think twice about going back.  The facilities were very dirty both times.  I watched as our table was "cleaned" with what appeared to be a well-used rag and had to deal with a very sticky table.  Our bench seat upholstery was shredded and stuffing was coming out.  The floor was filthy under the table.  My menu pages were covered in wet and goo.  I used another.  I pointed out that the menu needed a clean to the waiter  He said "absolutely", then I watched as he put it back in the general pile of menus on his way to the kitchen.  The spoon that came with my soup was dirty and I had to ask for another.  It really turned me off the food, even though the flavor was fine... I just wondered what else was dirty.  What is going on Bend Red Robin?

Now I know fours stars is high, especially for a town like Bend with great eateries. This is four stars for the kind of restaurant this is, family burger joint with some other food options. Price point is decent for a burger that is served to you and order taken at the table, $10. The fries are bottomless and tasty with the Red Robin seasoning salt. Food is pretty consistent here. You know what you are getting. Not fabulous but good enough. Besides burgers, the chicken strips are meaty and not too covered in breading. I always get the Whiskey River BBQ chicken wrap. My son likes the BLTA served on a croissant. The daughter varies between a Simple Burger vs Gardenburger. Burgers can also be served on lettuce only. They also have turkey burgers. The atmosphere is loud and so very family friendly. No one will be bothered when your younger child fusses. Lots of birthdays here. Singing and ice cream provided. Really the best thing is appetizers on the deck, in my opinion. View of the river. Old mill atmosphere. Just really quite nice and not terribly expensive! Tried the deep fried broccoli last night and liked it!! Also there is a $3 wedge salad that is the best deal around!! So yes, this is a chain. It is loud. The food is good enough. The price is fair. Lovely location. Customer be aware of where you are going and you will be happy. Don't set those expectations too high!

So disappointed! My family (party of 9) and I have enjoyed coming to RR restaurants for years. But it was a "thumbs down" kind of night at RR yesterday. Arrived about 6:15ish, 35 min wait ended up being 45 min.No problem it's a Thursday night. We get it :) Finally seated and the table looked wonky, milkshake, ranch dressing, crumbs under table. Asked if it could be cleaned. No problem - cleaned :) Menus were sticky and greasy.No problem it's 7pm a lot of people have come through :) Who's our server, Ryan? No. It must be Joe? No. Oh wait it's Megan after about 10 minutes. We ordered drinks and fries. Got drinks but no fries :( Had to flag down Megan to order food and remind her about fries :( Finally ordered and after a little while fries were brought to us, no sauces :( Ate the fries but wait, napkins? Oh, can you let Megan know we don't have napkins but wait she's busy with the customers at the next table. When she finishes she turns and asks, do you need napkins? Not anymore we wiped hands on our pants! :( Oh look, Wheel of Fortune is on "Is it past 7:30?" Yes! :( FINALLY the food arrives, it's good :) But we don't see Megan for awhile so we flag down Joe to change the tv channel because the Olympic Trials are coming on at 8! Thank you Joe :) To-go box? Asked a server walking by for a box. Didn't get server's name she brought 1 box! Thanks! :) By now my happy birthday isn't so happy and I don't want the free sundae! 7 of us leave before Megan FINALLY comes with the check. But my hubby says she did ask if I wanted the sundae. Awww, how sweet! Should I go back in? NO, Ben and Jerrys here I come! :) If you want a happy birthday skip Red Robin. :( btw My first review ever!!!

Red Robin...it's all about the burgers & fries right?  Apparently the kitchen staff doesn't realize it.    But wait, I jumped ahead of myself. After traveling to Bend on business, I was just looking for a quick, good meal close to the hotel.  As I walked into the bar, half the tables were full, and the rest were still dirty, including the bar.  It really didn't seem like the place was understaffed.   I waited for a spot at the bar, before moving to a table that was finally cleaned.  As for the food, their signature burger, the Reds Tavern double, came smashed down with under cooked fries.  They were very accommodating in replacing the meal, but after waiting for a clean table, it was irritating to wait again for my order to arrive correct.  The burger was good, not as good as it usually is at other Red Robin's and the fries were still not their normal deliciousness.   Hopefully this was just an off night. But after reading other reviews, you may want to consider other restaurants in the area. I will say that the waitstaff is very engaging and courteous.

My wife and I received terrible service at this red robin. We asked for a to-go "monster" sized milkshake. It barely filled half of the to-go cup, we complained but were told only that it was the correct size. I can't believe that we paid $6 for about 8 ounces of milkshake. Red robin is usually pretty good but we are very disappointed with this service

Arrived and was told we only had to wait a few minutes. After sitting for fifteen minutes, the host told us they were cleaning off tables and we would be seated soon. After waiting another fifteen minutes, I went and looked in the restaurant and most of the tables were empty. There were no employees to be seen, so I got tired of waiting and left. Also most of the video games were out of order, and the place was very dirty. Go spend your money elsewhere.

Stopped by at 9pm with two adults and five kids. Another party of 7 walked in at the same time and was seated immediately. We were told the waitress was overwhelmed and needed 15 minutes, we thought that was odd considering the restaurant was empty, but said no problem and sat in the waiting area. 15 minutes passed, the host returned and said it should only be 5 to 10 more minutes. We grew slightly more impatient but told him it was no problem and agreed to sit tight. The third time he came by he said she was just now wiping down our table and should be over to get us in 5 minutes. Huh?! Empty restaurant and a half an hour later...still don't have a table. We would've been happy to split up into two tables if it was such a hassle. After wasting 30 minute with 5 very hungry kids (post movie) at 9pm we ended up at Jack in the Box across town. Very upset and disappointed in what I thought was a fairly reliable chain restaurant. Will not be back.
Why is this place always mobbed? Poor service and mediocre food. Got marco pollo-- and the so called artisan bun was stale. Fries under cooked. Weak!

Service was good and the beer is good! The food was actually good too..I ordered a chicken sandwich and didn't realize they didn't ask me if I wanted crispy or grilled and they came with grilled...It was good but I like crispy :( had to knock a couple starts down since I would of eaten more of it if it was crispy...

I absolutely love Red Robin, that being said the last few times I've been here I have been sadly disappointed.. Food being over cooked, items being forgotten, rude waitresses, forgetting to do the birthday song for people.  The reason I am giving a 5 star review is solely based on this last time I went. It was my 21st birthday, we had a pretty big group. We were seated in a timely manor and our waiter Dylan was the most professional, kind dude. He checked on us and made us feel completely comfortable and welcome. Big thumbs up for Dylan, you guys need to keep him around he's the best waiter I've had there and has given me hope in this restaurant. Great job Dylan, thanks for the awesome birthday!

Terrible service even for Red Robin and been to over 20 red robins. Staff doesn't care! As for food maybe my mistake was ordering a salad , never have before. If you like over price lettace go for it.

I always have liked Red Robin but am typically disappointed with their service and fry portion. This particular location was amazing and the best I've ever been too! We had great service,amazing food and perfect portions!

As a avid RR guest, I was shocked this last experience. Had a late lunch around 2:30 pm. My guest and I only ordered one entrée  and one appetizer to share. The server/bartender was amazing on her game. The other staff members where very helpful with refilling our water glasses. But, unfortunately our order took over and hour in a half to arrive at our table; which was delivered my the 'manager' her name tag stated. But, she was already in med sentence before she arrived to the table and flop our dishes down. What was he shocking part was: She blamed "her" kitchen staff being lame and in the weeds. Ok, wait! You are the manager you should protect your employees'.  And not use restaurant slang (some people do not know nor use that). As a manger you should represent Mr. and  Mrs. Hubert in a much better way. Also, notice our dishes did not match what was listed on the menu.

This used to be one of our favorite places to eat..........used to be. Hadn't been there in a long time and decided to do a date afternoon with my wife. The hostess podium is dirty and in need of repair. The restaurant could use a lot of cleaning. The table top was old, worn out and sticky.  The menus also were sticky and felt like they were in need of sanitizing.  The servers used to be awesomely friendly and attentive. Used to be. Ours was slow and didn't really seem to care about customer service.  For example; when my wife asked for iced tea, he did not question whether she wanted regular or one of the various flavors they offer, she really wanted to try the raspberry. He brought her regular iced tea and a water for me. As he walked off I asked,  "what about my beer?" He turned around and said, "oh, that will be right out." When he finally delivered it, I took a few swigs then noticed a chunk of something brown on the bottom of the mug (I should have taken a picture), it looked like bird poop or something. I flagged him down and when he came over I pointed it out to him  and asked what he thought it was.  He said, "oh it's brownie" and went on to tell me that they serve dessert with brownie crumbles at the bar where he picks up the drinks. I told him it looked gross. He grabbed a napkin, wiped it off and said, "there, problem solved." I'm no expert, but I think most places would have brought me another one without the brown whatever on it.  The food used to be really good...........used to be. Both our burgers were luke warm when delivered to our table. The meat was 1/2 as thick as they used to be and although we both ordered them with "a little pink" they were both over cooked and dry. The Whiskey R8ver BBQ burger hardly had any BBQ sauce on it and although I ordered it without onions, yup, you guessed it, it had onions. When the server came by and asked how everything tasted, I said, "ok, but I ordered this without onions." His reply, "oh, I didn't even think about the shoestrings." We used to really enjoy our visits at Red Robin.............used to. Next time I am craving a good burger with a big juicy patty, served hot and the way I ordered it,  we'll go to Hardy's on 3rd street in Bend or Big Belly Burger and Brews in Sunriver.  Bye, bye Red Robin. I won't be wasting my hard earned $$$ there again.

Let's start with the service. The service was good. That is the only reason for the 1-STAR. Other than that this was my first time at this Red Robin. I had the Marco Polo and immediately went into the bathroom that was 4 hours ago and I haven't been able to get away from the bathroom since. It had to be something that was on that burger I was totally fine before eating there. I've never had this happen before. Not recommending this Red Robin and I won't go back there.

This is one of the dirtiest restaurants I've ever been to. The hostess laid our kid's menu right on top of some food left in the table from the previous diner -- either oblivious to the fact that the table was poorly cleaned or ignoring it. We asked them to clean the table and specifically asked them to fold down the table edge and clean in the crack where the table folds down. EWWWW. It's obvious that cleaning is a low priority. Even looking around now, the floor is littered with paper, crayons and just... trash. The chrome bar running behind our table is riddled with grimy fingerprints. I don't even want to think about the menu. Why is our table sticky? I need to go wash my hands. Again.  And, BTW, what's up with the TV in the bathroom stall?! Is that a normal thing for you guys?

The food was great. They have an amazing menu with reasonable price. Sarah was so cute and so perky and patient. (And I mean reeeally patient!!) But made everyone feel comfortable and as if she was happy that we were asking her a dozen questions! I keep thinking that Oregon has got a monopoly on the best servers!

Great setting on the river, nice waitress that took our order. After delivering our food she vanished.  I craved a good salad and ordered the Cobb salad. The menu said mixed greens but all iceberg. Salads were very light on condiments, maybe a half a piece of bacon, and maybe a teaspoon of blue cheese, couple pieces of egg.. twelve fifty, really! They both had a mini chicken breast, really disappointed. We rarely get fries so when we do it's a treat. These were saturated in grease and soggy, unedible. When a server finally brought the bill he took off the fries. They do have very cold beer.  I suppose stick to burgers.

Red Robin is what it is. Nothing to complain about the menu or options etc. But I've been to a few an this is by far the dirtiest. Service was so so. Our server looked to be about 15 and seemed a little scattered but she was trying very hard and was sweet. For a Saturday concert night I was shocked at how short staffed they were, maybe that is why it was so dirty? There a several stops along the river to eat, skip this one if you can.

Red Robin is what it is and I got what I expected. I would go back. Service was friendly and relatively prompt. I had a burger that was good. Ordered a berry lemonade which wasn't great or fresh so I got a chocolate milkshake instead which was really yummy. This restaurant is in a great location next to the Deschutes river. Beautiful view sitting outside.

We won't be dining here anymore.  Mediocre food.  Not even close to the menu pictures and descriptions.  You also need to shut done and scrub the place from top to bottom.  The layer of filth on the tables and edges is disgusting.  If the dining portion of the restaurant is this bad I can only imagine what the kitchen and Oreo areas look like.

We we're on vacation and stopped to eat  Service was ok quoted 45 min for a party of 13 witch I don't see why if the restaurant was half empty. Food was sitting in the window under the lamps for about 10-15 minutes and when we Finally got it many burgers and fries were cold, My family didn't say anything but I sent mine back and got something else.  My kid got food poisoning from here she was vomiting and had a fever and stomach pain I called and I was supposed to hear back from the General manager, and still haven't been contacted pretty bad if I say so myself.

Did expect much because I've never had that great of an experience at Red Robin but I think this was the worst one I've been to. Overall the restaurant was kind of dirty, there was a really long wait time even though it wasn't that busy. The food wasn't bad though better than I thought it would be honestly. It was freezing in there also. Not a great experience wouldn't recommend
Typical Chain Restaurant Fare.  Nothing terrible, but nothing special either.  The staff is very nice which makes it more pleasant.

It's not kept up, I'm pretty sure the tables never get cleaned. My husband sat in a hole in his seat. The waitress laughed when I pointed out that my kids meatball lollipops had broken breadsticks sticking out of the meatball. I believe her response was "haha, they are saving money everywhere they can". Save yourself, don't eat here. It's yucky.

Back in the day when this location first opened when I was in High school, it was the place to be and go and honestly the food was good for the price , but now days,I I should of wore some lipstick before I got f'ed!!! I ordered the blue cheese angus burger which didn't even have a price by it so I assumed 12.00 at the most. My parents got the 6 dollars siracha deal they had going on , thats what I should have got they bring me this burger on a "fancy yuppie plate" I guess to give the illusion it was huge, it looked like a slider , tiny little burger!!! My parents burgers where 5 x bigger and better tasting and looking then the check comes , at this point my stomach was starting to gurgle and I knew I was about to blow blue cheese out my ol' bung hole in their bathroom but I pinched my cheeks to read the ticket.... 15.45 for that f'ing slider that had already went through me , needless to say thank god the shopping centers are close because I had to purchase a new pair of panties after getting f'ed.I will leave Red Robins shitty chain food alone for now on. Lesson learned. My cheeks are still chapped.
Kenna is the server and Ryan the food runner were very good. Got the job done in a friendly  manner and quick turnaround. Customer service was good. Thanks guys

First off, the food was OK (as expected) but the order was incorrect (ordered sweet potato fries, served regular fries.)   The friendly staff quickly corrected the mistake, but then we had to ask for silverware.  Our server (Julien) was friendly and courteous, but maybe a bit over-tasked with his tables.  Second off, this place is DIRTY.  The table tops have achieved a state of "PERMA-STICKY" and the seats had food debris on them when we were seated.  Had to ask for napkins to clean our booth up... yuck.  Chipped paint on the walls, food or beverage splatters on the ceiling above the pass-through.  The carpets and cove-base are filthy... like sticky-filthy.  It's really sort of depressing.  No pay stations at the tables, no mention of customer loyalty program like at other Red Robins... this is like the Red Robin that time (and cleaning supplies) have forgot. We occasionally visit other Red Robins when traveling (Clackamas, Woodburn, etc.) and this place isn't even in the same universe.  Wondering if this is the difference between a franchised store and a corporate-ran store?  Either way, this place needs to be shut down for some deep cleaning and painting, and refresher courses for the wait staff on the small details of service they may be overlooking.   Won't likely be returning to this location.

It used to be good, back when John Churm was at the helm.  we went in for dinner last night after our oldest sons football game. Things have changed greatly and not in a good way. The server was good at first until she took our order. What she wrote down was not even close to what we ordered. After about 25 minutes the food arrives  we ordered 2 sides onion rings, they weren't delivered. I ordered a royal Red Robin nope it was missed, instead something else was brought out I'm not even sure what is was. I told the food runner I didn't order what she brought out she looked puzzled and promptly apologized for the mistake not her fault. I then told her about the onion rings, she reacted right away to fix the issue, after another 25 minutes of waiting my burger finally makes it appearance my family is pretty much done eating at this point. And I was just getting started. Mine was ok, my wife's was burnt to a crisp ours kids burgers looked like they had been smashed by the palm of someone's hand, onion dark brown and greasy due to old fryer oil. no napkins or silverware where brought to the table. It's Red Robin I don't expect world class service Or  food but get your shit together. Also the restaurant has become quite shabby over the last 4-5 years, tables are about to break, and are covered this disgusting sticky Grime. Bathrooms where extremely filthy. Urine all over the place. The restaurant just smells filthy as soon you walk in. We had asked to speak with a manager before we paid our bill we waited 15-20 minutes no manager arrived we just left after paying our bill. I doubt they notified one anyways.If Greg and Teresa Hubert still own this dump they should both be ashamed.
Dinner Visited during Veterans Day weekend  Super busy Service: very good attentive Facility: Noisy  overall Good experience, typical Red Robin

Quality has gone the way of the dead fish. (Down the crapper) terrible, cold burger. Paid extra for onion rings and got #3 of them on my plate. I think I laughed out loud. Will never go back.  Used to frequent but no longer!!

location: Campo de Golf Fonatur, San José del Cabo, Mexico
review: I ordered a veggie burger on a wedge. I received a veggie patty, wrapped in bacon. I pointed out there was no guacamole, and so they graciously added a 1/4 tsp. Vegetarian nightmare. Awful service. What a waste.
This was a fun time at the old mill district. I ordered a mac and salad which was alright, nothing special, but a good option for a lighter meal. The view of the river added to the atmosphere.

This must be the worst Red Robin in the country. The food is consistently cold, soggy and sad-looking and the service ranges from okay to downright rude.  Any way you cut it, this is one of the dirtiest restaurants in Bend. The tables are sticky. Food is always covering the booths and carpet. Oh and the booths are ripped! The bathrooms are a disaster zone. The bar area is unkempt. Their old decor is covered in dust and food splatter.  I love Red Robin; I hate this location.

Besides having an interior reminiscent of a bowling alley and the cleanliness about on par with one, I was disappointed from the start. Beer took ages to come to the table, and there's screaming kids running wild in the pit of family tables. The tv nearest my table hasn't worked in two years, according to the manager on duty at the time. And another one nearby just died. It took quite some time for the food to come out including the order of fries, by which i had already downed two tall drafts. Even bottomless french fries isn't enough to drown out the issues with this place.

We waited 45 minutes after we gave our order for it to finally come to our table. After letting the waitress know. We got crispy chicken salads and the chicken was cold and greasy tasting. I think it sat in the counter until it got cold. Our Grand daughters meal was cold. Not real impressed. Plus we think every table had a Birthday at it. Very loud with the clapping.  Not interested I going back.
